Suggested reading: Johnson comes home to GCU

Grand Canyon

2019-20 | Senior

Earned All-WAC second-team honors.

Led GCU in 3-pointers (45) and free throws (101), while ranking second to Alessandro Lever in scoring (15.5 ppg).

Ranked fifth in the WAC in overall scoring (15.5) and fourth in conference action (16.8).

Scored 1,000th point of college career in a home win over Seattle U on Jan. 23.

Ended career with a season-high 33-point performance on senior night in a win over CSU Bakersfield on March 7.

Earned a pair of WAC Player of the Week honors: on Feb. 10 following a 25-point performance at California Baptist on Feb. 8 and on March 9 following the 33-point senior-night performance.

Had seven games of 20 points or more.

2018-19 | Junior

Selected to the National Association of Basketball Coaches All-District 6, All-WAC second team and All-WAC Tournament teams.

Averaged a team-high 14.3 points in 24.3 minutes per game.

Posted 31- and 35-point games in the first two WAC Tournament games, becoming one of six Division I players to have 30-point games on successive nights in 2018-19.

His 35-point game against Utah Valley was the highest WAC Tournament scoring total since Keith Van Horn scored 37 in 1997.

Started final 11 games.

Scored at least 20 points in three successive games as a sixth man, becoming one of six players to do it by February last season.

Improved 3-point shooting from 16 percent (6 for 36) in the first 16 games to 42 percent (26 for 62) in the last 18 games.

Washington (Seattle)

2017-18 | Sophomore

Appeared in 17 games and averaged 8.5 minutes off the bench for the Huskies.

Opened season with 10 points on 3-of-3 shooting from the field and a 4-for-4 mark from the free throw line against Belmont on Nov. 10, 2017.

Again tallied 10 points at rival Washington State with 4-of-6 shooting on Jan. 6, 2018.

Played 16 total minutes in the final 18 games of the season under first-year head coach Mike Hopkins.

2016-17 | Freshman

Saw action in all 31 games and averaged 5.9 points and 3.0 rebounds.

Was Washington's fifth-leading scorer and second among freshmen behind 2017 NBA Draft No. 1 pick Markelle Fultz.

Scored in double figures on six occasions, including a career-high 19 points against Arizona State on Feb. 16, 2017. Shot 7 for 11 from the field and collected a team-leading 12 rebounds for first career double-double.

High School

Findlay Prep - Henderson, Nev.

Transferred to powerhouse Findlay Prep for his senior season.

Averaged 14.5 points in 20.5 minutes over 29 games.

Scored a career-high 43 points on Feb. 29, 2016.

El Cerrito High School - El Cerrito, Calif.

Played his junior season with the Gauchos.

Saw action in 29 games and averaged 15.9 points and 8.3 rebounds.

Shadow Mountain High School - Phoenix, Ariz.

Played his first two years of high school for the Matadors, helping the team to a state championship as a sophomore in 2014.

Teammates with fellow Lopes player J.J. Rhymes.

Averaged 11.9 points and 6.3 rebounds in 30 games as a freshman in 2012-13.

Personal

Parents are Carlos Johnson and Constance Leake.

GCU was his first college scholarship offer in high school.

Was club basketball teammates of Oscar Frayer on the Oakland Soldiers.

No stats available for the current season.
